name: Bear Mountain
description: Bear Mountain State Park is situated in rugged mountains rising from the west bank of the Hudson River. The park features a large play field, shaded picnic groves, lake and river fishing access, a swimming pool, Trailside Museums and Zoo, hiking, biking and cross-country ski trails.

name: Harriman State Park
description: Harriman State Park, located in Rockland and Orange counties, is the second-largest park in the parks system, with 31 lakes and reservoirs, 200 miles of hiking trails, two beaches, two public camping areas, a network of group camps, miles of streams and scenic roads, and scores of wildlife species, vistas and vantage points.
direction: Train: To catch a ride on the Port Jervis line to any of the stations on the west side of Harriman State Park, take the train from Penn Station to Secaucus Junction, New Jersey — about a ten-minute ride.  From Secaucus Junction, transfer to the Port Jervis line, heading north.

name: Beacon
description: Beacon, NY's popularity stems from a combination of factors, including its vibrant art scene, proximity to NYC, and desirable small-town charm. It's become a popular destination for those seeking a mix of artistic experiences, a relaxed lifestyle, and easy access to the city.
direction:
Car: 1hr 45mins
Train: Metro-North Railroad (MNR) operates a train from Grand Central Terminal to Beacon hourly.

name: Rockaway Beach
holiday: Labor Day: Saturday, August 31 – Monday, September 2, 2024
description: From surfers to swimmers to the Ramones, everyone wants to "hitch a ride to Rockaway Beach." Rockaway Beach is a year-round resource for residents all along the Rockaway peninsula, and it comes alive each summer from Memorial Day weekend through Labor Day weekend with millions of visitors.
direction:
Ferry: The Rockaway route of NYC Ferry will provide a key transit link between the Rockaways, Sunset Park, and Lower Manhattan while connecting New Yorkers to our city’s beaches.
Subway: You can get to Rockaway Beach a few different ways, including the ​A and Rockaway Park Shuttle S​ trains, bus, and Long Island Rail Road.

name: Hudson Train Ride
description: The "Hudson train rise" refers to a planned, multi-faceted project to improve the Hudson Line (Metro-North Railroad), specifically the section between New York City and Poughkeepsie.
direction: Train: The Metro-North Hudson Line runs north from Grand Central Terminal in New York City to Poughkeepsie.
